apiinstall.name: API Installation
apiinstall.content:
# **Install The API**
Access the API using the following in a **server-script**. ```lua local api = require(game:GetService("ReplicatedStorage").SmartOrders.Api) ``` From there you may use the following things in this guide.

points.name: Points
points.content:
# **SmartOrders API** ## **Points** ---
With SmartOrders, points are not able to be hacked. Therefore, to add points you must use the following API, or through using SmartOrders. The API Includes: - [​Add Points​]() - ​[Remove Points]()​ - ​[Get Points​]() - ​[On Point Changed​]() Please note that links don't work yet!

addpoints.name: Add Points
addpoints.content:
# **SmartOrders API** ## **Adding Points** ---
This command allows you to add points through the API. ### **Parameters** | Name | Type | Description | | ----------- | ----------- | ------- | | User ID | Integer | The ID of the user. Can be gotten from `Player.UserId`. | Points | Integer | The amount of points to add to the user. ### **Response** Coming Soon. ### **Example** ```lua api.Points:Add(123,1) ```

removepoints.name: Remove Points
removepoints.content:
# **SmartOrders API** ## **Removing Points** ---
This command allows you to remove points through the API. ### **Parameters** | Name | Type | Description | | ----------- | ----------- | ------- | | User ID | Integer | The ID of the user. Can be gotten from `Player.UserId`. | Points | Integer | The amount of points to remove from the user. ### **Response** Coming Soon. ### **Example** ```lua api.Points:Remove(123,1) ```

getpoints.name: Get Points
getpoints.content:
# **SmartOrders API** ## **Getting Points** ---
This command allows you get the user's points through the API. ### **Parameters** | Name | Type | Description | | ----------- | ----------- | ------- | | User ID | Integer | The ID of the user. Can be gotten from `Player.UserId`. ### **Response** Coming Soon. ### **Example** ```lua api.Points:Get(123) ```

onpointchanged.name: On Point Changed
onpointchanged.content:
# **SmartOrders API** ## **On Point Changed** ---
This command detects when a player's point's has changed through the API. ### **Parameters** | Name | Type | Description | | ----------- | ----------- | ------- | | Callback Function | Function | The function that will be ran when the point has changed.
### **Response** | Name | Type | Description | | ----------- | ----------- | ------- | | isManual | Boolean | If this is false, it means that the point was updated by SmartOrders. | pointAmount | Integer | The amount of points the user has. | player | PlayerObject | The player that has had the points updated.
### **Example** ## Point Bonus ```lua -- This example is so that if they get 1 point from SO, it'll give another. api.Points.OnPointChanged:Connect(function(isManual,pointAmount,player) if isManual == true then -- This is where if the points was updated by a in-game script, not SmartOrders, it'll return true. return end print("Point added by SO.") api.Points:Add(player.UserId,1) end) ``` ## Checking Points ```lua api.Points.OnPointChanged:Connect(function(isManual,pointamount,player) if pointamount % 150 then -- Promo time! As the point amount is divisble by 150. end end) ```

orders.name: Orders
orders.content:
# **SmartOrders API** ## **Orders** ---
With SmartOrders, orders can only be created through the machines or API. Therefore, to create or claim orders, you must use the following API:
The API Includes: - [​Create Order​]()
Please note that links don't work yet!

forcecreateorder.name: Create Order
forcecreateorder.content:
# **SmartOrders API** ## **Force-Creating an Order** ---

This command allows you to create an order through the API.
### **Parameters** | Name | Type | Description | | ----------- | ----------- | ------- | | Username | String | The name of the user. Can be gotten from `Player.Name`. | Items Orders | array | The names of items that are being served. Please follow the code example. | Cashier | Integer | The Cashier's UserId to give points to. Can be gotten from `Player.UserId`
### **Response** Coming Soon.
### **Example** ```lua api.Orders:ForceCreate("sasial",{"MenuItem1","MenuItem2"},123) ```
